result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin L Ptacek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Switchblade Knife, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.
DE to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin L Ptacek

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Probation revoked on motion of DE.

Defendant Kevin L Ptacek in court, in custody.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CM9, 15CM174.  DE has requested a motion hearing to self revoke probation.  DE does not wish to be represented by counsel.  Court instructs on DE w/o counsel.  Court will accept waiver of counsel.  DE will be sentenced to 20 days jail in each case, CC, DNA sample, surcharge, $150.00 fine on Ct 2 in 16CM9, all consecutive.  DE has credit for 42 days served.
Dated 8/09/16 from DOC to Judge Anderson,  re: hearing requested by DE concerning probation
Motion hearing on September 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
DE has indiacted he does not intend to seek PCR

Defendant Kevin L Ptacek in court with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  Heard along with 15CM174, 16CM9 and 16CM10.  Court reads agreement.  DE understands his rights and waives his rights.  DE enters NC Plea to all charges.  Court finds DE guilty.  State feels that DE may have an AODA issue.  Withhold sentence, probation 2 yrs in 15CM174 and 2 yrs probation on Ct 1 in 16CM10 and 2 years probation in case 16CM9, concurrent.  Pay fine and court costs in each case and DNA sample and pay surcharge.  

15CM135 -  DRI

15CM174 - NC plea

16CM9 - Ct1, DRI.  Ct2 NC plea.  

16CM10 - Ct 1 NC Plea.  Ct 2 DRI.

Defendant Kevin L Ptacek in court with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  Defendant Kevin L Ptacek in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CM174, 16CM9, 16CM10.  Set for RH 4-28-16 @ 1:00PM  Review hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Kevin L Ptacek in court with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 16CM10, 16CM9, 15CM135, 15CM174.  16CM10,16CM9-INIT APP-  Waive reading of the CC, enter plea of NG to misdemeanor counts.  Bonds continue, all bonds concurrent.  Set for RH 2-16-16 @ 1:00PM.  DE will report to jail for booking.

No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Defendant is not to possess or consume any medications not prescribed by a physician.  Not to possess or consume any illicit substances.  All prescribed medications must remain in the original container and be taken only as prescribed.  No contact with Wal Mart.  No drug paraphernalia.  All bonds concurrent.  Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.

DE appears in custody with Atty Bryce Schoenborn, State appears by James Rennicke.  Riverside hearing has previously been set.  DE has two prior open CM cases.  Parties make argument on there recommendations.  Atty Schoenborn asking for sign bond.  The court will order a $2500.00 sign bond,   Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.    Defendant is not to possess or consume any medications not prescribed by a physician.  Not to possess or consume any illicit substances meant to alter mind or mood.  All prescribed medications must remain in the original container and be taken only as prescribed.  DE will make living arrangements by tomorrow 12-02-15 and must contact the COCC office with the current address.  Set for INIT APP 1-19-16 @ 3:00PM.  DE will use mothers address for today.
